data.name: ACCQUOTE
data.value: Accept Quoted is an 11 digit item. Enter the date as day- month-year (11-JUL-1990). This captures the date when the policy was actually invoiced. The date is automatically captured during the Invoicing process.

data.name: ADDRESS
data.value: Address is a 30 character item. It is mandatory to enter the street & postal information. The second line is another 30 characters for continuation.

data.name: ALLEGE
data.value: ENTER THE CODE CORRESPONDING TO THE ALLEGATIONS MADE IN THE CLAIM. A LIST OF VALID CODES IS AVAILABLE THROUGH A FUNCTION KEY.

data.name: ALLFIRMS
data.value:
ALLFIRMS update and multi-key search
Name/Address Screen The first screen displays information about client's firm as supplied in the application. When you add a record, a new ISN is generated automatically. Make a note of it before clearing the screen. In Add mode, some of the items are mandatory, others have lists or defaults. The ISN will be generated and the progress record screen will follow.
The progress screen(the second screen of allfirms), allows you to track the progress of a quote into a policy. Every quote and every in-force policy in the policy system will have a corresponding progress record. The dates that describe the processing of the policy (like rated, mailed...) are filled in automatically as the Underwriting steps are completed.

data.name: APPLOG
data.value: Application Logged is an 11 digit item. Enter the date as day- month-year (11-JUL-1990). BD (beginning of day) is the default value for today's date. This captures when the application is being input in the system.

data.name: APPRECEV
data.value: Application Received is an 11 digit item. Enter the date as day-month-year (11-JUL-1990). BD (beginning of day)is the default value for today's date. This captures when the application was received at rma.

data.name: APPSIGN
data.value:
Application Signed is an 11 digit item. Enter the date as day- month-year (11-JUL-1990). This captures when the application was signed by the firm's representative.;
HELP-F49358: Retroactive Date:
-> use 'Jan 01 1900' (bogus date) to indicate retrodate not applicable (i.e. full prior acts).
-> use ' ' (blank) to indicate "at inception" when not covering full prior and effective date unknown.
-> use 'Xxx dd yyyy' (date of your choice) to indicate a specific date other than inception date or full prior acts.

data.name: BROKCONT
data.value: Individual Contact is a 30 character field. Enter the full name of the Brokers to deal with for this firm's application.

data.name: CITY
data.value: City is a 30 character item

data.name: CLASS
data.value: ENTER THE CODE REPRESENTING THE CLASS OF CLAIMANT HERE. A LIST OF VALID CODES IS AVAILABLE THROUGH A FUNCTION KEY.

data.name: CONDENSE
data.value: Condensed is a 14 character item. It is mandatory to enter an abbreviated version of the firm name. It is mainly used for sorting purposes.

data.name: CONSTYPE
data.value: Construction Type ----------------- 1 = Fire resistive 2 = Masonry non-combustible 3 = Non-combustible 4 = Masonry 5 = Masonry Veneer 6 = Frame

data.name: D35343
data.value:
Progress record This screen contains data that is pertainent to one application or renewal. The Brokers, ISN, company contacts, status and dates help to track the application/policy. All applications have a record. For firms with multiple applications, there is a progress record for each application. You can flip through these records, one after another in add, mod or inquire modes. Once one application is accepted as a policy, the other progress records are archieved.
There are mandatory fields that use lists, see the <HELP FIELD> descriptions. The date fields (10-11) use BD (beginning of day) as a default to today's date. Other fields are filled in automatically as the Underwriting steps are completed.

data.name: D35345
data.value:

All applications have a record. For firms with multiple applications, there is a progress record for each application. There are mandatory fields that use lists, see the <HELP FIELD> descriptions. The date fields (10-11) use BD (beginning of day) as a default to today's date. Other fields are filled in automatically as the Underwriting steps are completed

data.name: F11983
data.value: This amount will be split between pool member companies that are charged GST. In the case when this amount equals the total requested amount, the total is split among all pool members.

data.name: F11984
data.value: This amount will be split among pool member companies that are exempt from GST. If this amount is 0 then the total amount requested will be split among all pool members.

data.name: F12071
data.value: To select all SRD programs for an alphabetic listing enter '**'. Otherwise enter a valid program code, or leave blank to select all programs.

data.name: F12126
data.value: This value updates the field 'this-claim-limit" in the coverage table and doesn't represent the actual policy limit.

data.name: F12174
data.value: Identifies the type of firm. E = Expert L = Lawyer I = Investigator/Adjuster

data.name: F12176
data.value:
Identifies if the service partner is a member of panel.
P = Panel Member N = Non-Panel

data.name: F12180
data.value:
Identifies the lawyer used for defence and the lawyer that determines coverage.
C = Coverage D = Defence

data.name: F41300
data.value:
This fields is a flag to indicate whether the endorsement is standard or mid-term.
S - indicates standard endorsement (attached at inception) M - indicates mid-term endorsement (attached after inception)
Note that when endorsements print, mid-term endorsements get the appropriate trailer (for signatures, approvals, etc.). Standard endorsements do not print these trailers, since they are sent along with the policy itself.

data.name: F41934
data.value:
The following are the valid reasons for cancellation:
01 - Non compliance - cancel date is 45 days from today 02 - Claim history/frequency - cancel date is 45 days from today 03 - Non payment - cancel date is 15 days from today 04 - Insured/broker request 05 - Out of business 06 - Limits or coverage 07 - Misrepresentation 08 - Placed elsewhere 09 - Liability hazard 10 - Poor service 11 - Buy out / merge with other consultant;

data.name: F41938
data.value:
The following cancel methods are valid:
P = Pro-rata S = Short rate F = Flat M = Minimum retained

data.name: F41945
data.value: S - To cancel Short Rate M - To cancel MRP

data.name: F43693
data.value: PARENT ISN is a six digit optional field used to tie a current firm to a former firm numbers that have split or joined with other firms

data.name: F44837
data.value:
DIC - Difference in Conditions ------------------------------
Key Format: DIC-xx
where: DIC indicates a DIC endorsement is being entered -xx represents any whole number in the defined range of 15 thru 25, and is the rate at which the DIC endorsement will be offered.
The key MUST be entered in this format so that subsequent premium calculations will be performed as required, and documents will be produced with the proper information.

data.name: F49404
data.value:
DIVISION is a four character field which describes the type of Policy this firm is eligible for.
Valid values for this field are:
VALUE DESCRIPTION ----- ----------- PRAC Practice Policy FREE Claims Free Coverage INDV Individuals

data.name: F49405
data.value:
FIRMTYPE is a four character field describing the type of activity the firm engages in. Valid values for this field are:
VALUES DESCRIPTION
ARCH Architect ENGR Engineer COMB Combined (used only for DIVISION CORP)

data.name: F49432
data.value:
DIVISION is a four character field which describes the type of Policy this firm is eligible for.
Valid values for this field are:
VALUE DESCRIPTION ----- ----------- PRAC Practice Policy FREE Claims Free Coverage

data.name: F49433
data.value:
FIRMTYPE is a four character field describing the type of activity the firm engages in. Valid values for this field are:
VALUES DESCRIPTION
ARCH Architect ENGR Engineer DB Design Build CON Contractors

data.name: F49854
data.value: PARENT ISN is a six digit optional field used to tie a current firm to a former firm numbers that have split or joined with other firms

data.name: F49892
data.value:
STATUS is the state-of-being of this particular application:
STATUS EXPLANATION ------ -------------- CURR Current DEC Declined DQ Dead Quotes DECX Declined / transfered NEW First year in force OLD Previously insured, not current REAQ Reaquired Business SUBM Submission XFER Transfered to another insurer CANX Undoled

data.name: F49931
data.value:
STATUS is the state-of-being of this particular application:
STATUS EXPLANATION ------ -------------- CURR Current DEC Declined DQ Dead Quotes DECX Declined / transfered NEW First year in force OLD Previously insured, not current REAQ Reaquired Business SUBM Submission XFER Transfered to another insurer CANX Undoled

data.value:
STATUS is the state-of-being of this particular application:

data.value:

data.name: F50531
data.value:
DIVISION is a four character field which describes the type of Policy this firm is eligible for.
Valid values for this field are:
VALUE DESCRIPTION ----- ----------- PRAC Practice Policy FREE Claims Free Coverage

data.name: F50532
data.value:
FIRMTYPE is a four character required field the describes the type of activity engaged by the firm. Valid values are:
VALUE DESCRIPTION
ARCH Architecture DB Design Build ENGR Engineer SURV Surveyor COMB Combined (used only with CORP division) CON Contractors LAR Landscape Architects PM Project Managers of Construction Projects GEO Geo Scientists SURV Surveyors

data.name: F51254
data.value:
DIC - Difference in Conditions ------------------------------
Key Format: DIC-xx
where: DIC indicates a DIC endorsement is being entered -xx represents any whole number in the defined range of 15 thru 25, and is the rate at which the DIC endorsement will be offered.
The key MUST be entered in this format so that subsequent premium calculations will be performed as required, and documents will be produced with the proper information.;

data.name: F6074
data.value: This field indicates what policy database the policy information should be retrieved from.

data.name: F8948
data.value:
This field is used to determine what line of business the program should report under. Often the value in this field is the same as the value entered into the Database field. However, this is not always true. For Example, Land Surveyors retrieves policy information from the SRD Database. However, Land Surveyors are assigned AE claim/incident numbers and report under the AE line of business.
Land Surveyor example: Program Code : LS Description : Land Surveyors Database : SRD Line of Business: AE Pool Key : 21

data.name: FIRMNAME
data.value: Client Name is a 40 character item. It is mandatory to enter a name. The second line is another 40 characters for continuation. This is what will print in all correspondence.

data.name: FIRMTYPE
data.value:
Only the following Firmtypes are valid:
BR - Builder's Risk WB - Wood Frame WU - Wrap Up CGL - Project Liability

data.name: LANGUAGE
data.value: Language is a one character item. It is mandatory to enter E (English) or F (French).

data.name: POLBOUND
data.value: Policy Bound is an 11 digit item. Enter the date as day-month- year (11-JUL-1990). This captures the date coverage was bound for a policy.

data.name: POLMAIL
data.value: Policy Mailed is an 11 digit item. Enter the date as day- month-year (11-JUL-1990). This captures when the policy was mailed out of the office.

data.name: POOLNUM
data.value: This field represents the Pool Number assigned by the accounting department. There are different numbers for property and liability and also they differ depending on the layer limit. Please contact the accounting department for a valid Pool List.

data.name: POSTCODE
data.value: Postal Code is a 6 character item. It is set to receive Canadian codes. Enter the code as letter/digit/letter/space/ digit/letter/digit.

data.name: PROVINCE
data.value: AB Alberta BC British Columbia MB Manitoba NB New Brunswick NF Newfoundland NS Nova Scotia NT Northwest Territories NU Nunavut ON Ontario PE Prince Edward Island PQ Quebec SK Saskatchewan YT Yukon Territories

data.name: QUOTMAIL
data.value: First Quoted is an 11 digit item. Enter the date as day-month- year (11-JUL-1990). This captures when the quote was first quoted.

data.name: RATED
data.value: Rated is an 11 digit item. Enter the date as day-month-year (11-JUL-1990). This captures when the quote was estimated in the Underwriting group. It's automatically updated the 1st time through rating and it can be modified manually by the underwriter.
